transparency_law.name: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA)

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Immediately or as soon as practicable; maximum 15 calendar days. If not within 3 business days, written response required explaining when available.
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Maximum 15 calendar days for written denial or notification if additional time needed
response_requirements.extension_notes: If additional time needed beyond 15 days, written notification required within 15 calendar days
response_requirements.immediate_access_standard: Immediately or as soon as practicable

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Search fees are NOT permitted in New Mexico
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Reasonable fees for copies kept to actual cost; typical fee $0.25 per side

exemptions.description: Records pertaining to physical or mental examinations and medical treatment - broader than most states
Letters of reference and opinion memoranda in personnel or student files
Law enforcement records revealing confidential sources, methods, or unique investigative techniques
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Personal identifiers in combination with sensitive information
Information that would compromise security systems
Pending litigation materials covered by attorney-client privilege
Student educational records protected by federal law

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Government Counsel & Accountability team reviews complaints; informal resolution attempted
appeal_process.second_level: District Court - Mandamus or injunctive relief
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Courts may award attorney fees to prevailing requestors

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No requirement to state reason for inspecting records
requester_requirements.written_request_notes: Written requests recommended but not required

agency_obligations.response_options: Must permit inspection immediately or as soon as practicable; if not within 3 business days, written response required
agency_obligations.denial_requirements: Written denials must be delivered or mailed within 15 calendar days

oversight_body.name: New Mexico Attorney General - Government Counsel & Accountability
oversight_body.role: Statutory enforcement authority; informal complaint resolution
oversight_body.enforcement_authority: Can file lawsuits for IPRA violations if informal resolution fails

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official New Mexico statute. Variable timeline - immediately or as soon as practicable with 15 calendar day maximum. Search fees prohibited. No fee waivers. No administrative appeals. Medical records broadly exempted.
unique_characteristics: Variable timeline standard (immediately or as soon as practicable)
